original: Zåk, Frans Carl, musikdirektör, Göteborg, f. 24/1/97 i Bohumin, Tjecko-slov., av musikdir. Frans o. Dolfi Zàk. G. 23 m. Lisa Peterson. Barn: Majken f. 24. — Musikdir :ex. 20. Res. t. Tyskl. 26, USA 30, 39, Paris 37. Tid. kapellm. v. teat. i Brünn, v. St. Teat. i Gbg, or g. o. kördirig. v. katolska förs. i Gbg fr. 32, kapellm. v. Gbgs stadsteat. fr. 36. Medl. av TSO o. TG. Sv. medb. fr. 27. Komp. kyrkl. hymner. Hobby: filateh.
translated: Zåk, Frans Carl, music director, Gothenburg, born on January 24th, 1897 in Bohumin, Czechoslovakia, son of music director Frans and Dolfi Zàk. Married in 1923 to Lisa Peterson. Children: Majken, born in 1924. Became a music director in 1920. Traveled to Germany in 1926, USA in 1930 and 1939, and Paris in 1937. Was a chapel master at the theater in Brno, at the Gothenburg City Theater, and conducted the choir at the Catholic parish in Gothenburg from 1932. Became a chapel master at the Gothenburg City Theater in 1936. Member of the Gothenburg Symphony Orchestra and the Gothenburg Opera Chorus. Swedish citizen since 1927. Composed church hymns. Hobby: philately.
